intro: Homalium ceylanicum, commonly known as the Ceylon hibiscus, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
